alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa Inland; Santa Rosa Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 12:08PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Covington, northwestern Okaloosa and northeastern Santa Rosa Counties through NOON CDT... At 1107 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northwest of Baker, or 18 miles southeast of Brewton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Covington, northwestern Okaloosa and northeastern Santa Rosa Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for south central Alabama...and northwestern Florida.
